title: Queen Burger
content:
Which font is this?  
Seems a bit like Brasserie.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133242im_/http:/typophile.com/files/be872b04651b097046622e38d282f218_5390.jpg)

Font: 

 Thirsty script 

Solved By: 

 [donshottype](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133242/http:/typophile.com/user/205259 "View user profile.")
author: saeglopur

comments.content:
Thirsty Script Regular by Yellow Design Studio [https://www.fontbros.com/families/thirsty-script/styles/regular](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133242/https:/www.fontbros.com/families/thirsty-script/styles/regular "https://www.fontbros.com/families/thirsty-script/styles/regular")  
Don

Brasserie is a very good alternative. For this one, I'm pretty convinced [LΛNGE & LΛNGE](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133242/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fwww.behance.net/gallery/Queen-Burger/9655621) tweaked [Thirsty Script YDS](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133242/http:/myfonts.us/td-PVr5tu) ("mainly" rounding extremities).  
For the record, have a look [there](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133242/http:/typophile.com/node/93171) about Thirsty Script legitimacy...

Yes the tips are rounded, but it's still Thirsty Script. As for the legal issues they seem to have been resolved. Thirsty Script is now sold by Myfonts [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/yellow-design/thirsty-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133242/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/yellow-design/thirsty-script/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/yellow-design/thirsty-script/") This case calls for something to "wet the whistle" :)  
don
